summary: The memorandum from H. Clark Schor, Chief of the Plans and Review Group in the Central Cover Staff, serves as a supplement to prior communications with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). It provides detailed information on the contents of CCS files regarding individuals and entities under investigation by the HSCA, including the quantity of documents, their dates, and the types of information they contain.
key_findings: CCS files include information on notable figures such as George DeMohrenschildt, Leo Cherne, William Harvey, Richard Helms, James Angleton, Raymond Rocca, and the Wackenhut Corporation.
The documents encompass a variety of types, including contact reports, trace requests, cover documentation, TDY travel orders, and clearance verifications.
Certain subjects, including Alexander Rorke, Southern Research Corporation, and specific correspondence involving Messrs. Helms, Angleton, and Rocca, were not found in CCS records.
The Wackenhut Corporation is notably represented in the CCS files with 100 to 150 documents, mainly detailing interactions with its officials.
